unnormalised: ## Oh No, She Didn't! The Curious Case of the Abandoned Cart, Didi!
normalised: ## Oh No, She Didn't! The Curious Case of the Abandoned Cart, Didi!

unnormalised: We've all been there, haven't we? You're scrolling through Myntra late at night, fuelled by chai and the sheer boredom that only a Sunday night can bring. You find the perfect lehenga – it's exactly the right shade of Rani pink, embellished just like Kareena wore in "Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham," and on sale! You practically salivate. "Add to Cart," you whisper, your fingers trembling with excitement.

unnormalised: Then, reality hits harder than a Mumbai local at peak hour. Rs. 8,500 for that lehenga? Did I *really* need it? The EMI options start looking less scary and more like a lifeline. But still… you hesitate. You close the tab. And just like that, you've become a cart abandoner.

unnormalised: Didi, you're not alone! Cart abandonment is the bane of every e-commerce website's existence. It's like leaving a plate of steaming hot samosas untouched – unthinkable, yet it happens all the time.
normalised: Didi, you're not alone! Cart abandonment is the bane of every e-commerce website's existence. It's like leaving a plate of steaming hot samosas untouched – unthinkable, yet it happens all the time.

unnormalised: Why? Well, maybe the shipping charges were higher than your expectations – like finding out auto fare from CST to Dadar is going to be Rs. 300 after midnight. Or perhaps you got distracted by a WhatsApp forward about Baba Ramdev's latest yoga pose that guarantees eternal youth. Who knows!

unnormalised: But fear not, dear shopper! Many retailers, including our very own Flipkart and Amazon, are fighting back. They're armed with email reminders sweeter than Mysore Pak, tempting you to complete your purchase. Think of them as the matchmakers of the digital age, trying to reunite you with your cart full of dreams.

unnormalised: So next time you find yourself abandoning a cart, ask yourself: Am I really ready to let go of that handloom saree? Or that snazzy new phone cover? After all, what would Professor Shastri from IIT say if he knew we were leaving such potential happiness behind? Think about it! Maybe a small nudge (and a little discount code) is all you need to click that "Place Order" button. Happy shopping, folks!
